messages.content: [bitcoin] maflcko opened pull request #32476: refactor: Remove unused HaveKey and HaveWatchOnly (master...2505-bdb-removal-2) https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32476
< gmaxwell> I'd like to better understand why the two comments of k98kurz on #32406 are marked off-topic ...
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/32406 | policy: uncap datacarrier by default by instagibbs 路 Pull Request #32406 路 bitcoin/bitcoin 路 GitHub
I second that
IMO the current handling of OP_RETURN on Bitcoin Core side is technically sound, but a PR (as in public relationship) nightmare. That's logical - we are developers, not PR people...
there are plenty of coins out there that prioritise PR over technical soundness *shrug*
_aj_: that's only a point that's relevant when there is a conflict between the two!
In any case, it was a question-- presumably it has an answer. Might be a good one?  dunno!

yeah, i don't know the answer to that; the github moderation tools are pretty bad, and aiui the handful of people that have access to them for our repo aren't experts at using them, don't really like using them, and aren't confident they'll be supported when they do use them :-/

the discomfort with use can itself cause trouble. In any case I'm not trying to throw rocks, first I'd like to understand. And if then I disagreed then I'd like to convince. :P Though this is now the third time in this incident where I'm finding that efforts to diffuse public tensions are (potentially) frustrated by what appear to be unforced errors. and, lol, that's part of the fun too, but
its important to figure out if they were errors in fact and then just try to avoid future repetitions.
in theory https://github.com/bitcoin-core/meta/issues is the right place to report moderation mistakes fwiw, if nobody answers here
yeah I'll follow up later. Trying to have an informal direct discussion, and not directly invite disruptive elements to join the 'discussion' which appears to be the primary activity there.
[bitcoin] maflcko opened pull request #32477: lint: Check for missing trailing newline (master...2505-lint-newline) https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32477
gmaxwell i only see two marked-as-off-topic comments in 32406, FractalEncrypt and 1440000bytes
i was moderating the first PR more agressively when the brigading started but the second PR I pretty much let everything fly unless it was indisputably a personal attack or spam

the main moderaiton problems we had with comments on the first PR is questions like "is concept NACK a technical argument with no other substance?" and are comments like "no more spam on bitcoin" duplicates since they add no new information

all the more reason IMO to open disucssion for policy changes in an issue ir github discussion before a PR is open. Let all sides post their position statements, and then there wont be need for reiteration on the actual PR
gmaxwell: yes those two comments were indeed mistakenly hidden, and have since been un-hidden. Thanks for reporting.

willcl-ark: so just a misake?  Totally fine with me.

pinheadmz: yeah I wouldn't have commented on a usless "no moar spam" comment.  I mean, I think it's a problem but it's one that can't really be fixed on github. (needs to be solved with more friction to participate, so that most participants know commenting in that way isn't helpful).
gmaxwell: yep!
